tools.title: Tools Configuration
tools.allowedToolsDescription: Tools that are automatically allowed without prompting for permission
tools.disallowedToolsDescription: Tools that are automatically blocked without prompting for permission

mcp.description: Model Context Protocol servers provide additional tools and data sources to Claude

mcp.scopeUserDesc: User scope: Available across all projects on your machine

mcp.scopeCannotChange: Scope cannot be changed when editing an existing server

mcp.noToolsDiscovered: No tools, resources, or prompts discovered

cursor.skipPermissionsHint: Equivalent to -f flag in Cursor CLI
cursor.allowedShellCommandsDesc: Shell commands that are automatically allowed without prompting for permission
cursor.disallowedShellCommandsDesc: Shell commands that should always be denied

apiKeys.title: API Keys
apiKeys.description: Generate API keys to access the external API from other applications.
apiKeys.saveKeyDescription: This is the only time you'll see this key. Store it securely.
apiKeys.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this API key?

githubTokens.title: GitHub Tokens
githubTokens.description: Add GitHub Personal Access Tokens to clone private repositories via the external API.

credentials.title: GitHub Credentials
credentials.description: Add GitHub Personal Access Tokens to clone private repositories. You can also pass tokens directly in API requests without storing them.

tasksConfig.featuresAvailable: TaskMaster features will automatically become available

externalApi.title: External API Documentation
externalApi.description: Learn how to use the external API to trigger Claude/Cursor sessions from your applications.

chat.placeholderWithHints: Type / for commands, @ for files, or ask {{provider}} anything...

permissionMode.clickToChange: Click to change permission mode (or press Tab in input)

sendHint.ctrlEnter: Ctrl+Enter to send ‚Ä¢ Shift+Enter for new line ‚Ä¢ Tab to change modes ‚Ä¢ / for slash commands
sendHint.enter: Enter to send ‚Ä¢ Shift+Enter for new line ‚Ä¢ Tab to change modes ‚Ä¢ / for slash commands

commandExecution.bashConfirm: This command contains bash commands that will be executed. Do you want to proceed?

chat.selectProjectToChat: Select a project to start chatting with Claude
chat.chooseAssistantDesc: Select a provider to start a new conversation
chat.readyToUse: Ready to use {{provider}} with {{model}}. Start typing your message below.
chat.selectProviderAbove: Select a provider above to begin
chat.continueConversationDesc: Ask questions about your code, request changes, or get help with development tasks

errors.errorLoadingChat: An error occurred while loading the chat interface.

onboarding.gitConfigDescription: Configure your git identity to ensure proper attribution for your commits
onboarding.gitNameHint: This will be used as: git config --global user.name
onboarding.gitEmailHint: This will be used as: git config --global user.email
onboarding.bothFieldsRequired: Both git name and email are required
onboarding.invalidEmail: Please enter a valid email address
onboarding.claudeCodeDescription: Connect your Claude account to enable AI-powered coding features
onboarding.cursorDescription: Connect your Cursor account to enable AI-powered features
onboarding.loginInstruction: Click the button below to authenticate with {{provider}} CLI. A terminal will open with authentication instructions.
onboarding.stepOptional: This step is optional. You can skip and configure it later in Settings.

mainContent.chooseProjectDesc: Select a project from the sidebar to start coding with Claude. Each project contains your chat sessions and file history.
mainContent.tipMobile: Tap the menu button above to access projects
mainContent.tipDesktop: Create a new project by clicking the folder icon in the sidebar

projectWizard.title: Create New Project
projectWizard.chooseType: Do you already have a workspace, or would you like to create a new one?
projectWizard.existingWorkspaceDesc: I already have a workspace on my server and just need to add it to the project list
projectWizard.newWorkspaceDesc: Create a new workspace, optionally clone from a GitHub repository
projectWizard.whereToCreate: Where should the workspace be created?
projectWizard.existingPathHint: Full path to your existing workspace directory
projectWizard.newPathHint: Full path where the new workspace will be created
projectWizard.githubUrlHint: Leave empty to create an empty workspace, or provide a GitHub URL to clone
projectWizard.githubAuthDesc: Only required for private repositories. Public repos can be cloned without authentication.
projectWizard.tokenUsedOnce: This token will be used only for this operation
projectWizard.publicRepoTip: don't require authentication. You can skip providing a token if cloning a public repo.
projectWizard.noStoredTokens: No stored tokens available. You can add tokens in Settings ‚Üí API Keys for easier reuse.
projectWizard.addToProjectList: The workspace will be added to your project list and will be available for Claude/Cursor sessions.
projectWizard.cloneFromGithub: A new workspace will be created and the repository will be cloned from GitHub.
projectWizard.createEmptyWorkspace: An empty workspace directory will be created at the specified path.
projectWizard.selectWorkspaceType: Please select whether you have an existing workspace or want to create a new one

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.taskMasterDescription: TaskMaster helps break down complex projects into manageable tasks with AI-powered assistance
tasks.aiPoweredDesc: Break complex projects into manageable subtasks
tasks.prdTemplatesDesc: Generate tasks from Product Requirements Documents
tasks.dependencyDesc: Understand task relationships and execution order
tasks.progressDesc: Kanban boards and detailed task analytics
tasks.cliDesc: Use taskmaster commands for advanced workflows
tasks.gettingStartedSubtitle: TaskMaster is initialized! Here's what to do next:
tasks.step1Desc: Discuss your project idea and create a PRD that describes what you want to build.
tasks.step2Desc: Once you have a PRD, ask your AI assistant to parse it and TaskMaster will automatically break it down into manageable tasks with implementation details.
tasks.step3Desc: Ask your AI assistant to analyze task complexity and expand them into detailed subtasks for easier implementation.
tasks.step4Desc: Ask your AI assistant to begin working on tasks, update their status, and add new tasks as your project evolves.
tasks.prdTip: Start with a PRD to get the most out of TaskMaster's AI-powered task generation
tasks.setupCompleted: TaskMaster setup completed! You can now close this window.
tasks.updateError: Error updating task. Please try again.
tasks.updateStatusError: Error updating task status. Please try again.

git.title: Source Control
git.selectProject: Select a project to view source control
git.noCommitsDesc: This repository doesn't have any commits yet. Create your first commit to start tracking changes.
git.branchFromCurrent: This will create a new branch from the current branch ({{branch}})
git.gitNotFoundDesc: Run git init in your project directory to initialize git source control.
git.runGitInit: Run git init in your project directory to initialize git source control.
git.discardFile: Discard all changes to "{{file}}"? This action cannot be undone.
git.deleteUntracked: Delete untracked file "{{file}}"? This action cannot be undone.

quickSettings.title: Quick Settings
quickSettings.sendByCtrlEnterDesc: When enabled, pressing Ctrl+Enter will send the message instead of just Enter. This is useful for IME users to avoid accidental sends.
quickSettings.promptEnhancementDesc: Transform rough ideas into clear, detailed AI prompts
quickSettings.vibeModeDesc: Format ideas as clear agent instructions with details

shell.selectProjectDesc: Choose a project to open an interactive shell in that directory

fileTree.title: Files
fileTree.checkPath: Check if the project path is accessible
fileTree.tryDifferentSearch: Try a different search term or clear the search

prdEditor.keyboardShortcuts: Press Ctrl+S to save ‚Ä¢ Esc to close
prdEditor.provideFilename: Please provide a filename for the PRD.
prdEditor.addContentBeforeGenerating: Please add content to the PRD before generating tasks.
prdEditor.proTip: üí° Pro Tip: Ask Claude Code Directly!
prdEditor.proTipDesc: You can simply ask Claude Code in the chat to parse your PRD and generate tasks. The AI assistant will automatically save your PRD and create detailed tasks with implementation details.
prdEditor.exampleText: I've just initialized a new project with Claude Task Master. I have a PRD at .taskmaster/docs/{{filename}}. Can you help me parse it and set up the initial tasks?
prdEditor.thisWillDesc: Save your PRD, analyze its content, and generate structured tasks with subtasks, dependencies, and implementation details.
prdEditor.moreExamples: For more examples and advanced usage patterns:
prdEditor.gotIt: Got it, I'll ask Claude Code directly
prdEditor.overwriteConfirm: A PRD file named "{{filename}}" already exists. Do you want to overwrite it with the current content?

taskMasterSetupWizard.title: TaskMaster Setup Wizard
taskMasterSetupWizard.step1Desc: Configure basic TaskMaster settings for your project
taskMasterSetupWizard.step2Desc: Ensure TaskMaster MCP server is properly configured
taskMasterSetupWizard.step3Desc: Create or import a Product Requirements Document
taskMasterSetupWizard.step4Desc: Initialize TaskMaster and generate initial tasks
taskMasterSetupWizard.failedToCheckMcp: Failed to check MCP server status. You can continue but some features may not work.
taskMasterSetupWizard.prdRequired: Please create or import a PRD to continue
taskMasterSetupWizard.configureTaskMaster: Configure TaskMaster settings for your project
taskMasterSetupWizard.mcpServerDesc: TaskMaster works best with the MCP server configured
taskMasterSetupWizard.mcpServerConfigDesc: To enable full TaskMaster integration, add the MCP server configuration to your Claude settings.
taskMasterSetupWizard.prdDesc: Create or import a PRD to generate initial tasks
taskMasterSetupWizard.prdPlaceholder:
# Product Requirements Document

## 1. Overview
Describe your project or feature...

## 2. Objectives
- Primary goal
- Success metrics

## 3. User Stories
- As a user, I want...

## 4. Requirements
- Feature requirements
- Technical requirements

## 5. Implementation Plan
- Phase 1: Core features
- Phase 2: Enhancements
taskMasterSetupWizard.aiTaskGenerationDesc: TaskMaster will analyze your PRD and automatically generate a structured task list with dependencies, priorities, and implementation details.

taskMasterSetupWizard.step3Action: Generate initial tasks from your PRD
